description: This table holds demographic information for the patients in the cohort. There is only one row per patient

fields.comment_field:
Known Deceased; Not Known Deceased

Please note: Vital status is not known deceased or deceased status in EHR. Only in-hospital death is recorded, for the most part. Blank values in Care Connect are reported as "Not Known Deceased." Vital status data in CareConnect is not currently linked to the California death registry or any other sources e.g. CDC death data
List of possible values can be provided upon request
Values in CareConnect include: Male, Female, Other or Unknown
List of possible values can be provided upon request
List of possible values can be provided upon request

fields.description: Year of patient's last UCLA encounter
A de-identified, unique ID number for the individual patient (assigned by IP for coding purposes)
fields.comment_field: Use this variable to link to variables from all other files that contain patient information

fields.description: A de-identified, unique ID number for the patient's current primary care provider (PCP) (assigned by IP for coding purposes)
fields.comment_field: The PCP logic takes into account the patient's visit history and the active providers at UCLA to calculate the best match possible in each scenario. Patients without visit history are left blank. Additionally, if a provider leaves UCLA, the patient's PCP assignment is reset to blank until a new PCP can be established.  Use to link to provider information in the Provider file e.g. can link up with IP_PROVIDER_ID in Providers file

fields.description: Patient current age (as of data extraction date), or if patient is known deceased, age at death (if known)

fields.comment_field: List of all possible values can be provided upon request
Patient race records are converted into more general race classifications (e.g. Chinese is represented as Asian). A detailed summary can be provided upon request.

description: This table holds identifying information for the patients in the cohort. There is only one row per patient.

fields.description: A de-identified, unique ID number for the individual patient (assigned by IP for coding purposes)
fields.comment_field: Use this variable to link to variables from all other files that contain patient information

MRNs should have 7 digits. Please note that depending on how you import the data, some MRNs that have a leading “0” may show as only having 6 digits. This is because the MRN is missing its leading “0”. Please correct this and add the leading 0 back into the dataset and also add the leading 0 back if looking up the patients in CareConnect for chart review.

description: This table holds Socio-Economic information for the patients in the cohort. There is only one row per patient

fields.description: Neighborhood area of deprivation index (ADI)  ranked scores at the national level
fields.comment_field: Link to Area Deprivation Index website: https://www.neighborhoodatlas.medicine.wisc.edu/

fields.description: A de-identified, unique ID number for the individual patient (assigned by IP for coding purposes)
fields.comment_field: Use this variable to link to variables from all other files that contain patient information

fields.description: Percentile ranking for Household composition theme according to the Social Vulnerability Index
fields.comment_field:
Null values show -999. 
This variable corresponds to RPL_THEME2
The CDC has used the 2018 American Community Survey 5 year dataset for their calculations. 
For more information visit: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/documentation/SVI_documentation_2018.html (document also attached)

fields.description: Neighborhood Income Level of the patient
Overall percentale ranking or the Social Vulnerability Index
fields.comment_field:
Null values show -999. 
This variable corresponds to RPL_THEMES.
The CDC has used the 2018 American Community Survey 5 year dataset for their calculations. 
For more information visit: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/documentation/SVI_documentation_2018.html (document also attached)

fields.description: Neighborhood area of deprivation index (ADI)  ranked scores at the state level
fields.comment_field:
A raw score is the actual score a neighborhood receives based on the theoretical domains that the ADI measures. A decile groups the ADI scores into 10 equal sections., categorizing the individual block group/neighborhood, with those in the first percentile being the least disadvantaged, and those in the hundredth being the most. Deciles are created for each state individually.
Link to Area Deprivation Index website: https://www.neighborhoodatlas.medicine.wisc.edu/ 
Citation
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health. {specify year} Area Deprivation Index {specify version}. Downloaded from https://www.neighborhoodatlas.medicine.wisc.edu/ {date}

Example: University of Wisconsin School of Medicine Public Health. 2015 Area Deprivation Index v2.0. Downloaded from https://www.neighborhoodatlas.medicine.wisc.edu/ May 23, 2019.

fields.description: Neighborhood area of deprivation index (ADI)  ranked scores at the state level
fields.comment_field: A raw score is the actual score a neighborhood receives based on the theoretical domains that the ADI measures. A decile groups the ADI scores into 10 equal sections., categorizing the individual block group/neighborhood, with those in the first percentile being the least disadvantaged, and those in the hundredth being the most. Deciles are created for each state individually.

fields.description: Neighborhood Education Level of the patient
Percentile ranking for Socioeconomic theme according to the Social Vulnerability Index
fields.comment_field:
Null values show -999. 
This variable corresponds to RPL_THEME1.
The CDC has used the 2018 American Community Survey 5 year dataset for their calculations. 
For more information visit: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/documentation/SVI_documentation_2018.html (document also attached)

fields.description: Percentile ranking for Minority status and language theme according to the Social Vulnerability Index
fields.comment_field:
Null values show -999. 
This variable corresponds to RPL_THEME3.
The CDC has used the 2018 American Community Survey 5 year dataset for their calculations. 
For more information visit: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/documentation/SVI_documentation_2018.html (document also attached)

fields.description: Percentile ranking for Housing type and Transportation theme according to the Social Vulnerability Index
fields.comment_field:
Null values show -999. 
This variable corresponds to RPL_THEME4.
The CDC has used the 2018 American Community Survey 5 year dataset for their calculations. 
For more information visit: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/documentation/SVI_documentation_2018.html (document also attached)

description: This table holds the insurance information for the patients in the cohort.  There can be multiple rows per patient as well as multiple rows per encounter.

fields.description: The date after which the coverage is no longer in effect for the member and the member becomes ineligible for benefits
The name of the payor associated with the dates effective for this row
The name of the financial class for the payor associated with the dates effective for this row
A de-identified, unique ID number for the individual patient (assigned by IP for coding purposes)

The date on which the coverage goes into effect for the member
